versionA.text:
Agent 99 highly skilled spy working for a secret agency. She has inﬁltrated en­emy ter­ri­tory and has stolen a large quantity of highly valu­able top se­cret new ma­te­r­ial. She needed to pass as much as possible those ma­te­ri­als to friendly agents with­out be­ing no­ticed by en­e­mies, so she de­vised a ge­nius plan. 
 
 Agent 99 will dis­guise as bungee jumper jump­ing to­gether from a bridge. She will se­cretly tie a certain amount of ma­te­ri­al to her body so that the bungee cord, which you can think of as a spring, will stretch long enough to let him reach the wa­ter sur­face, where friendly agents on a dis­guised ﬁshing kayak will catch him and take the weights from him. 
 
 Of course, Agent 99 needs to be heavy enough so that she reaches the boat, but if she car­ries too much of the ma­te­r­ial upon hit­ting the boat, then she risk sink­ing the boat! 
 
 The bungee cord she will be us­ing has a spring con­stant of 35.0 N/​m, and length of 25.0 me­ters. 
 
 What is the max­i­mum amount of weight (in kg) the agent can carry so that she does not crash the boat upon landing? Retain two decimal places for your answer. (use g=9.8) 
 
 Please col­lab­o­ra­tive with your part­ner, each of you can re­quest 2 out of 5 pieces of in­for­ma­tion from the be­low to solve the ques­tion.

hint.a: weight of top secret new material agent 99 stolen
hint.b: height from the bridge to the water surface
hint.c: maximum speed of falling agent that the boat can handle
hint.d: weight of the friendly agent on the boat

hintText.a: Agent 99 has stolen a total of 50.0 kg of highly valuable top secret new material
hintText.b: water surface is 100.0 m below the bridge
hintText.c: if speed exceeds 6.0m/s, then agent risk sinking the boat!
